attributes.action: immediately remove the tax exemption status enjoyed by elected members of the House of Commons on the taxpayer funded allowances and benefits in kind they receive.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Members of Parliament are employees and have no right to enjoy benefits over income tax relief and tax-free allowances (funded out of taxpayer pounds) which are not also available to the wider group of income tax payers.  Particularly the lack of tax on benefits in kind, such as subsidised food and alcohol which is available in the many clubs in the HofC and the provision of vehicular transport and free bus and rail journies for them and their families is something which MUST be stopped forthwith.  They have no entitlement to it, except that they voted it in for themselves.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
